<hi rend="ital">masc.</hi> usu. of the plant, <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> of the essence, etc., but the distinction is not closely observed. </sense><sense id="n11678.1" n="(a)" level="5"> Crocus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 182</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cul. 399</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">plur. nom.</hi> croci, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:393" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 393</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> crocos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 1, 16; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:442" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 442</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:208" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 208</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11678.2" n="(b)" level="5"> Crocum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 80</bibl> Dietsch; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:31 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 6, 17, § 31 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n11678.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Gen. incert.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:416" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 416</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:342" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 342</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 318</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 2:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 2, 23, 2</bibl> Dietsch; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:4:4 al" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 4, 4 al.</bibl>—Frequently employed among the ancients, not only for the seasoning of food and in medicine, but transformed, by means of water and wine, to an essence, for the diffusion of a fragrant odor in theatres and other places; <cit><quote lang="la">for anointing the hair, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 6, 17, § 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:416" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 416</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 1, 16; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:25 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 25 al.</bibl>; cf. Cilix and Cilissa, under Cilicia. II. a.—Hence, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">recte necne crocum floresque perambulet Attae Fabula si dubitem,</quote> <trans><tr>over fragrant floors</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 79</bibl></cit>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Crŏcus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Crŏcŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a youth who was metamorphosed into a saffron-flower</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4</bibl>. 283; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:227" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 227</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 35, 63, § 154</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11678.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n11678.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Saffron-color</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">picta croco et fulgenti murice vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:614" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 614</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1188</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n11678.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The yellow stamens in many flowers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 5, 11</bibl>, §§ 23 and 24.</sense></entryFree>
crocuphantia: <entryFree id="n11679" type="main" key="cro^cu_phanti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŏcūphantĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-fantĭa</orth>) = crocota, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:25:section=10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 25, § 10</bibl>.</entryFree>
crocuta: <entryFree id="n11680" type="main" key="cro^cu_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŏcūta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. crocotta.</entryFree>
crodunum: <entryFree id="n11681" type="main" key="Crodunum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crodunum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n11681.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place in</hi> Gallia Narbonensis, now <hi rend="ital">Gourdan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 5, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
croesus: <entryFree id="n11682" type="main" key="Croesus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Croesus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kroi=sos</foreign>, <sense id="n11682.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of Lydia, celebrated for his riches</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:19:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 19, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:27:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 27, 87</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:7:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 7, 2</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl> (3), 26, 23 al.— Appel. for <hi rend="ital">a rich man</hi>, in contrast with Irus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:7:42" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 7, 42</bibl>; and in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:6:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 6, 4</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n11682.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Croesĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Crœsus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 578</bibl></cit>. <pb n="484" /> <cb n="CRUC" /></sense></entryFree>
crommyuacris: <entryFree id="n11683" type="main" key="Cro^mmy^u_a_cris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crŏmmyū-ācris</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Crŏmy-</orth>), <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kromu/ou a)/kris</foreign>, <sense id="n11683.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the most northern point of Cyprus</hi>, Cass. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 13, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
cromyon: <entryFree id="n11684" type="main" key="Cro^my^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crŏmyon</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Cremmyon</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 11, § 23</bibl>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kromu/wn</foreign>, <sense id="n11684.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a village in Megaris, afterwards belonging to Corinth, laid waste by a wild sow, which was slain at last by Theseus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:435" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 435</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cronia: <entryFree id="n11685" type="main" key="Cro^ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crŏnĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ta\ *kro/nia</foreign>, <sense id="n11685.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a festival of Saturn, celebrated in Greece, and especially at Athens</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 7, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cronos: <entryFree id="n11686" type="main" key="Cro^no^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crŏnŏs</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kro/nos</foreign>, <sense id="n11686.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the god of time</hi>, = Saturnus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 15, 61 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
crosmis: <entryFree id="n11687" type="main" key="crosmis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crosmis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n11687.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of sage</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 101</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crotalia: <entryFree id="n11688" type="greek" key="cro^ta^li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŏtălĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">krota/lia</foreign>, <sense id="n11688.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rattling ear-pendant, composed of several pearls</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 56, § 114</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crotalisso: <entryFree id="n11689" type="main" key="cro^ta^lisso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŏtălisso</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">krotali/zw</foreign>, <sense id="n11689.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to rattle</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sound with the castanet</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Diff. 21, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crotalistria: <entryFree id="n11690" type="greek" key="cro^ta^listri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŏtălistrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">krotali/zw</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n11690.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a</hi> (<hi rend="ital">female</hi>) <hi rend="ital">castanet dancer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 8, 39. —</sense><sense id="n11690.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., <hi rend="ital">a</hi> (<hi rend="ital">rattling</hi>) <hi rend="ital">stork</hi>, P. Syrus ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 55</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 97</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
crotalum: <entryFree id="n11691" type="greek" key="cro^ta^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŏtălum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kro/talon</foreign>, <sense id="n11691.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rattle, a bell, castanet</hi>, used to accompany wanton dances, P. Scip. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:9:20 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 9, 20 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
crotaphos: <entryFree id="n11692" type="greek" key="cro^ta^pho^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŏtăphŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kro/tafos</foreign>, <sense id="n11692.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pain in the temples</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 11:4" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 11, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
croto: <entryFree id="n11693" type="main" key="Cro^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crŏto</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Crŏton</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:18:5" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 18, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 19, 3</bibl>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> (and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Crŏtōna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 20, 4</bibl>; also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cortōna</orth>, like corcodilus for crocodilus; cf. Ritschl in Rhein. Mus. vol. 8, p. 475, and vol. 9, p. 480), = <foreign lang="greek">*kro/twn</foreign>, <sense id="n11693.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town founded by the Achaians, on the east coast of Bruttium</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Crotone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 15, § 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:3:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 3, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 19, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:15 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 15 al.</bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n11693.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Crŏtōnĭātes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*krotwnia/ths</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">an inhabitant of Crotona</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alcmaeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:11:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 11, 27</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Crŏtōnĭātae</orth>, <hi rend="ital">inhabitants of Crotona</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:1:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 1, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 3, 15</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Crotoniatūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 3, 9</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Crotoniatăs, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 3, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11693.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Crŏtō-nĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Crotona</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:36:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 36, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:19:11" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 19, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Milo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 54, § 144</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 6</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Crŏtōnĭenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Crotona</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 10, § 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:2 sq" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 20, 2 sq.</bibl>—The same: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Crŏtōnenses</orth>, Front. ap. Strat. 3, 6, 4.</sense></entryFree>
crotopiades: <entryFree id="n11694" type="main" key="Cro^to_pi^a^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crŏtōpĭădes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*krotwpia/dhs</foreign>, <sense id="n11694.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Crotopiade</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Linus</hi> (whose mother, Psamathe, was the daughter of the Grecian king Crotopus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:478" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 478</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crotos: <entryFree id="n11695" type="main" key="Cro^to^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crŏtŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kro/tos</foreign>, <sense id="n11695.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a constellation, the Archer;</hi> pure Lat. Sagittarius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:57" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 57</bibl>; access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Crŏtōn</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 224" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 224</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
cruciabilis: <entryFree id="n11696" type="main" key="cru^ci^a_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŭcĭābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>crucio</etym>, <sense id="n11696.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">tormenting, torturing, painful, excruciating, miserable</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): cruciabilem me accipito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 40</bibl></cit> Ritschl: <cit><quote lang="la">exitu periit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:9:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 9, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">mors,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> adv. Gent. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silentio fatigatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 239, 20</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n11696.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Susceptible of torture</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 20, 9</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">crŭcĭābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with torture</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 40</bibl> Fleck., Lorenz: interfecti, Auct. B. Afr. 46.</sense></entryFree>
cruciabilitas: <entryFree id="n11697" type="main" key="cru^ci^a_bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŭcĭābĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cruciabilis</etym>, <sense id="n11697.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">torment, torture</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruciabilitates animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cruciabundus: <entryFree id="n11698" type="main" key="cru^ci^a_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŭcĭābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>crucio</etym>, <sense id="n11698.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">torturing, tormenting</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Ep. 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cruciamen: <entryFree id="n11699" type="main" key="cru^ci^a_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŭcĭāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11699.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">torture, torment, pain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">leti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 10, 90</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cruciamentum: <entryFree id="n11700" type="main" key="cru^ci^a_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŭcĭāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11700.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">torture, torment, pain</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">vidi ego multa saepe picta quae Acherunti fierent Cruciamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 2, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">carnificum (with tormenta morborum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut orbitatis cruciamenta sentiret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, p. 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cruciarius: <entryFree id="n11701" type="main" key="cru^ci^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŭcĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>crux</etym>, <sense id="n11701.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the cross</hi>, or, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to torture.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11701.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exitus,</quote> <trans><tr>full of torture</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Praescr. Haeret. 2</bibl></cit> dub. (al. cruciatorios): <cit><quote lang="la">poenae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11701.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst., one who is crucified</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 3:21" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 3, 21</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n11701.3" n="B" level="2"> As a term of reproach, <hi rend="ital">one fit for the gallows, a gallows-bird</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 242</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">longum est quae cruciarius ille conflavit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 2, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cruciatio: <entryFree id="n11702" type="main" key="cru^ci^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŭcĭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>crucio</etym>, <sense id="n11702.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a torturing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 6, 9</bibl>. <cb n="CRUD" /></sense></entryFree>
cruciator: <entryFree id="n11703" type="main" key="cru^ci^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŭcĭātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>crucio</etym>, <sense id="n11703.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tormenter, torturer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, p. 23</bibl>; Firm. Math. 3, 13, 6.</sense></entryFree>
cruciatorius: <entryFree id="n11704" type="main" key="cru^ci^a_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŭcĭātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. cruciarius, 1.</entryFree>
cruciatus: <entryFree id="n11705" type="main" key="cru^ci^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŭcĭātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n11705.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">torture, torment, a torturing, execution</hi>, etc. (often syn. with supplicium; freq. and class. in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>). </sense><sense id="n11705.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of the body: <cit><quote lang="la">dedisti hodie in cruciatum Chrusalum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 3, 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 5, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:4:section=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 4, § 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 63, § 163</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:41:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 41, 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 24:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 24, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:18:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 18, 14</bibl> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:4:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 179</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">cruciatu malo dignus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 132</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11705.2" n="2" level="3"> Of the mind: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:9:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 9, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes animi cruciatus et corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">confectus jam cruciatu summorum dolorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 11, 1</bibl></cit>; Cic. Fil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 21, 2</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n11705.3" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">ruin, calamity, misfortune</hi> (esp. in curses, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">maximum in malum cruciatumque insiliamus,</quote> <trans><tr>into utter ruin</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum cruciatu tuo istaec hodie verba funditas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to thy ruin, misfortune</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:4:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 4, 2, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 161</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">abi in malum cruciatum,</quote> <trans><tr>go to the gallows, go hang</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 3, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 25</bibl>; cf. crux, II.—</sense><sense id="n11705.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">instruments of torture</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ignes ardentesque laminae ceterique cruciatus admovebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:63:section=163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 63, § 163</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
crucifer: <entryFree id="n11706" type="main" key="cru^ci^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŭcĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>crux-fero</etym>, <sense id="n11706.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the crossbearer</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Christ</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 3, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crucifigo: <entryFree id="n11707" type="main" key="cru^ci^fi_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŭcĭfīgo</orth>, <itype>ēre, better separated</itype>, cruci figo; v. crux.</entryFree>
crucifixor: <entryFree id="n11708" type="main" key="cru^ci^fixor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŭcĭfixor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>crux-figo</etym>, <sense id="n11708.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a crucifier</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 18, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crucio: <entryFree id="n11709" type="main" key="cru^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŭcĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>crux</etym>. <sense id="n11709.0" n="I" level="1"> Orig., <hi rend="ital">to put to death on the cross, to crucify</hi> (only in eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Mort. Pers. 2, 1</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n11709.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to put to the rack, to torture, torment</hi> (freq. and class., esp. in the signif. B.). </sense><sense id="n11709.2" n="A" level="2"> Physically: <cit><quote lang="la">cum vigiliis et fame cruciaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:20:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 20, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunos militum verberatos servilibusque omnibus suppliciis cruciatos trucidando occidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:18:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 18, 14</bibl></cit> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum cruciabere dirae Sanguine serpentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:651" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 651</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruciataque diris Corpora tormentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:694" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 694</bibl></cit> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui advehuntur quadrupedanti crucianti canterio,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>torturing the rider by its uneasy motion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11709.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> of inanimate things: <cit><quote lang="la">terra ferro, ligno, igni, lapide, fruge omnibus cruciatur horis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 63, 63, § 157</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aes cruciatur in primis accensumque restinguitur sale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 3, 20, § 65</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11709.4" n="B" level="2"> Mentally. </sense><sense id="n11709.5" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">graviter adulescentulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:78 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 78 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">officii me deliberatio cruciat cruciavitque adhuc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ipsus sese cruciat aegritudine!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne crucia te, obsecro, anime mi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos major sollicitudo cruciat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:3:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 6, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud me cruciat, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:94:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 94, 5</bibl></cit>. —So <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanto dolore cruciatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:13:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 13, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11709.6" n="(b)" level="5"> Medial (only in Plaut. and Ter.), <hi rend="ital">to afflict one's self, to grieve, be afflicted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut miserae matres cruciantur!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">crucior miser,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 2, 10</bibl></cit>; with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crucior me lapidem non habere, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 2, 6</bibl>; and with <case>acc.</case> of <hi rend="ital">neutr. pron.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">istuc crucior, a viro me tali abalienarier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crucisalus: <entryFree id="n11710" type="main" key="Cru^ci^sa^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crŭcĭsălus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>crux-salio</etym>, <sense id="n11710.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a name facetiously formed in imitation of</hi> Chrysalus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a cross-dancer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere aliquem Crucisalum ex Chrysalo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 128</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
crucium: <entryFree id="n11711" type="main" key="cru^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŭcĭum</orth>, quod cruciat. Unde Lucilius vinum insuave crucium dixit, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=53:4" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 53, 4</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
crudaria: <entryFree id="n11712" type="main" key="cru_da_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crūdārĭa vēna argenti</orth>, <sense id="n11712.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vein of silver that lies directly on the surface in a mine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 6, 31, § 97</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crudelis: <entryFree id="n11713" type="main" key="cru_de_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crūdēlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kru/os</foreign>; Lat. crudus, cruor, caro</etym>, <sense id="n11713.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">morally rude</hi> or <hi rend="ital">unfeeling</hi>, with exclusive reference to conduct towards persons or things, <hi rend="ital">hard, unmerciful, hard-hearted, cruel, severe, fierce</hi> (freq. and class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n11713.1" n="I" level="1"> Of living subjects. </sense><sense id="n11713.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: crudeles gaudent in tristi funere fratris, <cb n="CRUD" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 72</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">crudelis in calamitate hominis consularis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:48:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 48, 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui nimis videtur senatus in conservandā patriā fuisse crudelis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 8, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11713.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in eos, quos numquam viderat, tam crudelis fuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in liberos atque in sanguinem suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:10:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 10, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quos Sulla crudelis hoc socio fuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in patriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 6, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:56:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 56, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11713.4" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudelem Castorem, ne dicam sceleratum et impium!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudelis atque importuna mulier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:63:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 63, 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malus atque crudelis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o crudelis adhuc, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Neptunus tanto amori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl></cit> (3), 26, 45 et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecquid acerbius? ecquid crudelius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis timeo ne in eum exsistam crudelior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heu, Fortuna, quis est crudelior in nos Te deus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 61</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parricidae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11713.5" n="II" level="1"> Of inanimate subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">crudele et exitiosum bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o rem cum auditu crudelem tum visu nefariam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:41:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 41, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poena in cives crudelis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tam crudelem necessitatem incidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:25:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 25, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinora (with foeda),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudele intolerandumque imperium (opp. justissimum atque optimum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 51:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 51, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 175</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 64, 136</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:69:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 69, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 64, 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">venenum vitae nostrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:77:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 77, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl></cit> (3), 15, 43: <cit><quote lang="la">verber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:695" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 695</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:612" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 612</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:585" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 585</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">egestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:459" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 459</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid faciat? crudele, suos addicere amores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:617" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 617</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:62:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 62, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">janua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:16:17" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 16, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:701" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 701</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid crudelius, quam? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:85" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 85</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen tyranni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 30</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <hi rend="ital">advv.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11713.6" n="a" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">crūdēlĕ</orth> (prop. <hi rend="ital">neutr. sing.</hi> of <pos>adj.</pos>), <hi rend="ital">cruelly</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:211" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 211</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 340</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Eutr. 2, 108</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n11713.7" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">crūdēlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">cruelly, in a cruel manner</hi> (very freq.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 12, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:24:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 24, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:61 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 61 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:29:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 29, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:62:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 62, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:442" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 442</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:27:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 27, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 14, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 6, 3</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
crudelitas: <entryFree id="n11714" type="main" key="cru_de_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crūdēlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>crudelis</etym>, <sense id="n11714.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">harshness, severity, cruelty, barbarity</hi> (in good prose and very freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">crudelitas est atrocitas animi in exigendis poenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 2:4:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 2, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudelitas est inclinatio ad asperiora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 2:4:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ista in nostros homines crudelitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:88:section=150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 88, § 150</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:8:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 8, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 11, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:65:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 65, 135</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:53:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 53, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 8, 5</bibl> et saep.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Perieg. 2291 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in meo inimico crudelitatem exprompsisti tuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 13, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudelitatem exercere in vivo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 3, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
crudeliter: <entryFree id="n11715" type="main" key="cru_de_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crūdēlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. crudelis <sense id="n11715.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> b.</sense></entryFree>
crudesco: <entryFree id="n11716" type="main" key="cru_desco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crūdesco</orth>, <itype>dŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n11716.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [crudus], <hi rend="ital">to grow harsh</hi> or <hi rend="ital">violent, to increase, grow worse</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. not before Virg.): coepit crudescere morbus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:504" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 504</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pugnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:788" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 788</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum magicā linguā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:431" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 431</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:680" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 680</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">crudescente irā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:4:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 8, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 8:57" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 8, 57</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cruditas: <entryFree id="n11717" type="main" key="cru_di^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crūdĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> (lit. <sense id="n11717.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">indigestion;</hi> hence, meton.), </sense><sense id="n11717.1" n="I" level="1"> (Effectus pro causa.) <hi rend="ital">An overloading, repletion of the stomach</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:13:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 13, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 18, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:15:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 15, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:21:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 21, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:9:11" default="NO">5, 9, 11</bibl>; Col. prooem. § 16; 6, 6, 1 al.—</sense><sense id="n11717.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of plants: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores laborant et fame et cruditate,</quote> <trans><tr>superabundance of nutritious juices</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 219</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11717.3" n="II" level="1"> (Abstr. pro concr.) <hi rend="ital">Undigested food</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruditates digerunt daucum, plantago, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 7, 25, § 41</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cruditas fructuum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>bitterness</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 9, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cruditatio: <entryFree id="n11718" type="main" key="cru_di^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crūdĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>crudito</etym>, i. q. cruditas, <sense id="n11718.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an overloading of the stomach, indigestion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:2:29" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 2, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crudito: <entryFree id="n11719" type="main" key="cru_di^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crūdĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>crudus</etym>, <sense id="n11719.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to suffer from indigestion</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Jejun. 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Apol. 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crudus: <entryFree id="n11720" type="main" key="cru_dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crūdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>root kru-, of Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kru/os</foreign>; cf. cruor, crudelis</etym>, <sense id="n11720.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bloody, bleeding, trickling with blood</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n11720.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (so rare): <cit><quote lang="la">vulnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:16:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 16, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:11:19" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 11, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:3:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 3, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11720.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n11720.3" n="A" level="2"> Of food, <hi rend="ital">raw, not cooked</hi>: quid tu curas, utrum <pb n="485" /> <cb n="CRUE" /> crudum an coctum edim? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 2, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 27, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carnem mandere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 37</bibl></cit>.—So also of <hi rend="ital">undigested</hi> food: <cit><quote lang="la">pavo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:143" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 143</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">trop.: lectio non cruda sed multā iteratione mollita et velut confecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 19</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, alvus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui crudum ructat,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>when undigested food rises in the stomach</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>; v. ructo.— <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of persons <hi rend="ital">suffering from indigestion</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:8:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 8, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 49</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:60:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 60, 168</bibl></cit>; cf. cruditas; so, <cit><quote lang="la">bos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:8:6" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 8, 6</bibl></cit> Orell. ad loc.—Hence, in a pun, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:13:3 sq" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 13, 3 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n11720.4" n="B" level="2"> In gen., of all physical or moral crudeness, immaturity, roughness, etc. </sense><sense id="n11720.5" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n11720.6" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Unripe, immature, crude</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">poma ex arboribus, cruda si sunt, vix evelluntur, si matura et cocta, decidunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:19:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 19, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pruna (opp. maturissima),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:10:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muria (opp. matura),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:6:2 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 6, 2 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 317</bibl></cit> (viridis, Schol.); <cit><quote lang="la">of an abscess,</quote> <trans><tr>not mature</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:64:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 64, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:11:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 11, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">funera nepotis,</quote> <trans><tr>premature, early</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:391" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 391</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Achill. 1, 478</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <trans><tr>yet young, fresh</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:341" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 2, 341</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">crudum adhuc servitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adhuc studia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudi sine viribus anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:348" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 348</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventus,</quote> <trans><tr>not yet armed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:302" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 302</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Hon. 3, 42</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11720.7" n="(b)" level="5"> Opp. to age, and the weakness arising from age, <hi rend="ital">fresh, vigorous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam senior, sed cruda deo viridisque senectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:304" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 304</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">imitated by Tac.: quibus cruda ac viridis senectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 29</bibl></cit>: cf. <cit><quote lang="la">meus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:569" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 569</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11720.8" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Unprepared, immature, raw, crude</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudum et immotum solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:25" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 19, 49, § 179</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:20:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 20, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=116" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 116</bibl></cit> Müll.; for which, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, taurus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:250" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 250</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, caestus,</quote> <trans><tr>made of raw hide, undressed leather</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rudis cortice crudo hasta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 743</bibl></cit>.—Of verses, <hi rend="ital">unpolished, rude</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">junctura addita crudis (numeris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:92" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 92</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si forte aliquid decoctius audis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:125" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 125</bibl></cit>).—Of the voice, <hi rend="ital">rough, hoarse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia crudus fuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:27:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 27, 125</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11720.9" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n11720.10" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Raw, not prepared</hi> or <hi rend="ital">matured</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut cibos mansos ac prope liquefactos demittimus, quo facilius digerantur, ita lectio non cruda, sed multā iteratione mollita et velut confecta memoriae tradatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11720.11" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Rough, unfeeling, cruel, merciless</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n11720.12" n="(a)" level="5"> Of personal subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">dicat me Crudum virum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 8, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 148</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 240</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Getae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:3:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cena, crude Thyesta, tua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:49:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 49, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudus et leti artifex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 1220" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 1220</bibl></cit>.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n11720.13" n="(b)" level="5"> Of things as subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:8:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 8, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:682" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 682</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:113" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:342" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 342</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tyrannis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:223" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 223</bibl></cit>: crudissimum pistrinum, <hi rend="ital">most rude, uncultivated</hi>, Cassius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 4</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> not in use.</sense></entryFree>
cruentatio: <entryFree id="n11721" type="hapax" key="cru^enta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŭentātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cruento</etym>, <sense id="n11721.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a staining with blood</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">altaris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cruente: <entryFree id="n11722" type="main" key="cru^ente_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŭentē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. cruentus <sense id="n11722.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> a.</sense></entryFree>
cruenter: <entryFree id="n11723" type="main" key="cru^enter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŭenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. cruentus <sense id="n11723.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> b.</sense></entryFree>
cruentifer: <entryFree id="n11724" type="hapax" key="cru^enti^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŭentĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cruentus-fero</etym>, <sense id="n11724.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bloody</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Jud. Dom. 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cruento: <entryFree id="n11725" type="main" key="cru^ento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŭento</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cruentus</etym>, <sense id="n11725.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make bloody, to spot with blood</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n11725.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: vigiles, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus suorum sanguine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 10, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 9, 4</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 58 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornipedem ferratā calce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:541" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 541</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:424" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 424</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ōs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:104" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruentati redeunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:572" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 572</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sequenti die Luna se in Aquario cruentaret,</quote> <trans><tr>would appear to be stained with blood</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11725.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec te lacerat, haec cruentat oratio,</quote> <trans><tr>wounds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:34:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 34, 86</bibl></cit> (v. the figure in its connection).—</sense><sense id="n11725.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> * </sense><sense id="n11725.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To spot, stain, pollute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1033" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1033</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11725.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To dye red, to tinge with red</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">conchylio vestis cruentatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr 2:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr 2, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:5:38" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 5, 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cruentus: <entryFree id="n11726" type="main" key="cru^entus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŭentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cruor</etym>, <sense id="n11726.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">spotted, covered</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">stained with blood, bloody.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11726.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cruentus sanguine civium Romanorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 4, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguine fraterno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caede filii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:8:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadaver Clodii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 13, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehiculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:48:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 48, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:30" default="NO">6, 1, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetexta C. Caesaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">31: vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:9:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">busta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 13</bibl></cit> (3, 5), 38: <cit><quote lang="la">sputa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 5, 68 et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">victoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 58:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 58, 21</bibl></cit>: pax, Tac. A. <cb n="CRUS" /> 1, 10: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:A. 3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspectu Oceanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 32</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudens Bellona cruentis,</quote> <trans><tr>in shedding blood</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 223</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vomica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n11726.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n11726.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Delighting in blood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blood-thirsty, cruel</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Mars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 14, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. Marc. 20:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. Marc. 20, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille (Achilles) ferox belloque cruentior ipso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:592" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 592</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11726.4" n="b" level="4"> Of abstract subjects, <hi rend="ital">bloody, cruel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:3:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 29, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:71:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 71, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille cruentissimus Romano nomine dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:52:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 52, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11726.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Spotted</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stained with blood, polluted</hi>: insigne summi capitis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1137</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11726.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Bloodred, red</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">myrta,</quote> <trans><tr>the red myrtle-berry</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:306" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 306</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Advv.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11726.7" n="a" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">crŭentē</orth> (post-Aug.), <hi rend="ital">cruelly, severely,</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:3:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 39, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:2:7" default="NO">23, 2, 7</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:16:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 16, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 21</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Oros.</author> 1, 17</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n11726.8" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">crŭenter</orth>, <itype>the same</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 73</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crumena: <entryFree id="n11727" type="main" key="cru^me_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŭmēna</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">crŭmīna</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>for scrumena; root scru-, of scrutor, scrotum</etym>, <sense id="n11727.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small money-purse</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bag</hi> (usually hanging from the neck). </sense><sense id="n11727.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:3:1:7 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 3, 1, 7 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 3, 63</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 37</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11727.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, like our <hi rend="ital">purse</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">money</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non deficiente crumenā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:38" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crumilla: <entryFree id="n11728" type="main" key="cru^milla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŭmilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>crumena</etym>, <sense id="n11728.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little purse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 6, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crumino: <entryFree id="n11729" type="main" key="cru^mi_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŭmīno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11729.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fill like a purse</hi>, Ven. Vit. S. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:350" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 350</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cruor: <entryFree id="n11730" type="main" key="cru^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crŭor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cf. <foreign lang="greek">kre/as, kru/os</foreign>, caro, crudus</etym>. <sense id="n11730.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Blood</hi> (which flows from a wound), <hi rend="ital">a stream of blood</hi> (more restricted in meaning than sanguis, which designates both that circulating in bodies and that shed by wounding): <cit><quote lang="la">e nostro cum corpore sanguis Emicat exsultans alte spargitque cruorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 194</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 47</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">cruor inimici recentissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 7, 19</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis per venas in omne corpus diffunditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:55:138 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 55, 138 al.</bibl></cit>; v. sanguis; cf., however, under II.; class.; <cit><quote lang="la">most freq. in the poets): occisos homines, cruorem in locis pluribus vidisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,006:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Tull. 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi cruor appareat, vim non esse factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:27:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 27, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res familiaris, cum ampla, tum casta a cruore civili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 4, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:32:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 32, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:30:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 30, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:883" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 883</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 24, § 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:59" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 59</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 121</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 253</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 388</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:542" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 542</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 469 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 1, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 3, 6</bibl> et saep.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:687" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 687</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:330" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 330</bibl>; cf. the foll.—</sense><sense id="n11730.1" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">scit cruor imperii qui sit, quae viscera rerum,</quote> <trans><tr>the vital power</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:579" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 579</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11730.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">bloodshed, murder</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc cruor, hinc caedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3</bibl></cit> (38), 60; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 161</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 463</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 275</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:1022" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 1022</bibl>. —In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:636" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 636</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11730.3" n="II" level="1"> Sometimes, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, i. q. sanguis, for <hi rend="ital">the blood in the body</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:669" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 669</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:787" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 787</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:131" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 131</bibl>; 1, 864 (for which <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:860" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 860</bibl> and 867, sanguen).</sense></entryFree>
cruppellarii: <entryFree id="n11731" type="foreign" key="cruppellarii"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cruppellarii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Celtic</etym>, <sense id="n11731.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">harnessed combatants among the Gauls</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cruralis: <entryFree id="n11732" type="main" key="cru_ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crūrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>crus</etym>, <sense id="n11732.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the legs, crural</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fasciae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 40, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:25" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cruricrepida: <entryFree id="n11733" type="main" key="Cru_ri^cre^pi^da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crūrĭcrĕpĭda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>crus-crepo</etym>, <sense id="n11733.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Rattle-shin, the feigned name of a slave, about whose legs blows</hi> or <hi rend="ital">chains rattle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crurifragius: <entryFree id="n11734" type="main" key="cru_ri^fra_gi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crūrĭfrāgĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> crus-frango], <sense id="n11734.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one whose legs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shins are broken</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 64</bibl> (cf. crus).</sense></entryFree>
crus: <entryFree id="n11735" type="main" key="cru_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crūs</orth>, <itype>ūris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>etym. dub.; prob. kindr. with curro, currus; cf. celer, and -cello in recello, etc.</etym>, <sense id="n11735.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the leg, shank, shin.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11735.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: perque fabam repunt (grues) et mollia crura reponunt, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg.
