G. 3, 76</bibl> (Ann. v. 545 Vahl.); imitated by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 76</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:444" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 444</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:478" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 478</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:652" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 652</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:36:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 36, 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 46, 63, § 129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:139" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 139</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:306" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 306</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 580</bibl> et saep. The legs of criminals were frequently broken, as a punishment, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:20:56 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 20, 56 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 12, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:67" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 67</bibl>; cf. crurifragius.—</sense><sense id="n11735.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n11735.3" n="A" level="2"> For pes, <hi rend="ital">foot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 74</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11735.4" n="B" level="2"> Of plants, <hi rend="ital">the lower part of the stalk</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:10:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:18:5" default="NO">3, 18, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 35, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crusculum: <entryFree id="n11736" type="main" key="cruscu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cruscŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>crus</etym>, <sense id="n11736.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small</hi> <cb n="CRUX" /> <hi rend="ital">leg</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shank</hi>, Plaut. Fragm. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=52:20" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 52, 20</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> ib. p. 53, 1</bibl> ib.</sense></entryFree>
crusma: <entryFree id="n11737" type="greek" key="crusma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crusma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">krou=sma</foreign>, <sense id="n11737.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a musical piece</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tune played upon a stringed instrument</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:71:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 71, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> Fragm. 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crusmaticus: <entryFree id="n11738" type="greek" key="crusma^ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crusmătĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">krousmatiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n11738.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">suitable for playing on a musical instrument</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars musicae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> Fragm. 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
crusta: <entryFree id="n11739" type="main" key="crusta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crusta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cf. crudus</etym>, <sense id="n11739.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the hard surface of a body, the rind, shell, crust, bark</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n11739.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">luti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:626" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 626</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">soli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:2:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 53, § 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glandis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 28, 34, § 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 28, 44, § 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locustarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 30, 50, § 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulcerum,</quote> <trans><tr>the scab</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 10</bibl>: fluminis, <hi rend="ital">a covering</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crust of ice</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:360" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 360</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n11739.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., t. t. of plastic art, <hi rend="ital">inlaid, chased</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">embossed work on walls</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vessels, plasterwork, stucco-work, mosaic work</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parietis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 12, 45, § 154</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 6, 7, § 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (vasa) probarant, eis crustae aut emblemata detrahebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:23:section=52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 23, § 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 6, 6, § 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:48" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 6, 7, § 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capaces Heliadum crustae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:38" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:32:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 32, § 1</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n11739.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: non est ista solida et sincera felicitas; crusta est et quidem tenuis, <hi rend="ital">plaster-</hi> or <hi rend="ital">outside-work</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 6:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Prov. 6, 3</bibl>; cf. tectorium.</sense></entryFree>
crustarius: <entryFree id="n11740" type="main" key="crusta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crustārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>crusta, II.</etym>, <sense id="n11740.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to embossed work.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11740.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: tabernae, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=53:6" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 53, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11740.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">crustārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one who makes embossed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">chased figures</hi>, on plate, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 12, 55, § 157</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crusto: <entryFree id="n11741" type="main" key="crusto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crusto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>crusta</etym>, <sense id="n11741.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cover with a rind, shell, incrustation, plaster-work, embossed figures</hi>, etc. (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">mala gypso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 17, 18, § 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum marmoribus,</quote> <trans><tr>to incrust</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 114</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">portam crasso ferro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: vasa potoria crustata, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=53:6" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 53, 6</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">crustata crassities pectoris et ventris,</quote> <trans><tr>incased with fat</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 189, 18</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">crustāta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. animalia), <hi rend="ital">crustaceous animals, shellfish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 62, § 165</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crustosus: <entryFree id="n11742" type="hapax" key="crusto_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crustōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11742.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">covered with a hard rind, crusted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bdellium crustosius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 9, 19, § 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
crustula: <entryFree id="n11743" type="main" key="crustu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crustŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11743.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little rind, shell</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">crust</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, p. 84</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crustularius: <entryFree id="n11744" type="main" key="crustu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crustŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>crustulum</etym>, <sense id="n11744.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who makes pastry, a confectioner</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 56:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 56, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crustulum: <entryFree id="n11745" type="main" key="crustu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crustŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>crustum</etym>, <sense id="n11745.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">small pastry, confectionery</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=107" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 107</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:5" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 99:27" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 99, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 100, 5 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
crustum: <entryFree id="n11746" type="main" key="crustum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crustum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>access. form to crusta</etym>, <sense id="n11746.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pastry, any thing baked</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 115</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 173, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">373, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crustumeria: <entryFree id="n11747" type="main" key="Crustu^me^ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Crustŭmĕrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 19, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:42:3" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 42, 3</bibl>); <orth extent="full" lang="la">Crustŭmĕrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 68</bibl>); <orth extent="full" lang="la">Crustŭmĕri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:631" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 631</bibl>); and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Crustŭmĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:367" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 367</bibl>), <sense id="n11747.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient town in the country of the Sabines, north-east of Fidenæ</hi> later belonging to the Tuscans, now <hi rend="ital">Monte Rotondo;</hi> cf. O. Müll. Etrusk. 1, p. 113.—</sense><sense id="n11747.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, * </sense><sense id="n11747.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Crustŭmĕrīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Crustumeria</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">secessio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=81" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 81</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n11747.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Crustŭmīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:14:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 14, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 5, 9, § 53</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">campi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:64:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 64, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:37:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 37, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:25:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 25, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:16:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 16, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:10:4" default="NO">12, 10, 4</bibl>; cf. the foll.: tribus, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=55:10" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 55, 10</bibl>; cf. O. Müll. above cited.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Crustŭmīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Crustumeria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9, 8</bibl>, and 1, 10, 2 sq. —* </sense><sense id="n11747.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Crustŭmĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of Crustumeria</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 88</bibl></cit>; cf. the preceding.</sense></entryFree>
crux: <entryFree id="n11748" type="main" key="crux"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crux</orth>, <itype>ŭcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<gen>m.</gen>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 195, 13</bibl>; Gracch. ap. Fest. s. v. masculino, p. 150, 24, and 151, 12 Müll.) [perh. kindred with circus]. <sense id="n11748.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n11748.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a tree, frame</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">other wooden instruments of execution</hi>, on which criminals were impaled or hanged, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 3:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Prov. 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 3, 10</bibl> sqq.—</sense><sense id="n11748.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a cross</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 5, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:3:section=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 3, § 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 4, § 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:18:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 18, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:30:92" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 30, 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 82</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 7</bibl>, <pb n="486" /> <cb n="CUBA" /> 47; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 48</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">dignus fuit qui malo cruce periret, Gracch. ap. Fest. l. l.: pendula,</quote> <trans><tr>the pole of a carriage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:3:28" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 3, 28</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n11748.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n11748.4" n="A" level="2"> As a term of reproach, <hi rend="ital">a gallows bird, a hempen rascal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11748.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">torture, trouble, misery, destruction</hi>, etc. (so most freq. in Plaut. and Ter., and in the former esp. freq. in connection with mala): aliqua mala crux, <hi rend="ital">tormentor</hi> (of a prostitute), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 48</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">illae cruces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae te mala crux agitat?</quote> <trans><tr>what tormentor troubles you?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abstraxit hominem in maximam malam crucem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. prol. 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaerere in malo crucem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 3, 11</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">summum jus antiqui summam putabant crucem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:7:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 7, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, in colloq. lang.: <cit><quote lang="la">I (abi, etc.) in malam crucem!</quote> <trans><tr>go to the devil! go and be hanged!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 57</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 7, 86 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 21</bibl>; cf.: <hi rend="ital">Cy.</hi> Num quid vis? <hi rend="ital">Me.</hi> Ut eas maximam in malam crucem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 2, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 9</bibl>.—Without mala: <cit><quote lang="la">I in crucem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 91</bibl></cit>.—And ellipt.: <cit><quote lang="la">in malam crucem!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 4, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 5, 2, 5</bibl>. —Hence, Ital. <hi rend="ital">croce;</hi> Fr. <hi rend="ital">croix.</hi></sense></entryFree>
cryphiolathronia: <entryFree id="n11749" type="main" key="Cry^phi^o^la^thro^ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cryphĭŏlăthrŏnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">kru/fiosla/qra</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n11749.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of an imaginary country</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 43</bibl> Ritschl (ex conj.; Brix, Scytholatronia).</sense></entryFree>
crypta: <entryFree id="n11750" type="greek" key="crypta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crypta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kru/pth</foreign>, <sense id="n11750.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a concealed, subterrunean passage, a vault, cavern, cave, grotto, pit</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 169, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:58" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:106 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 106 al.</bibl>—As <hi rend="ital">a place of deposit</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11750.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp.: crypta Neapolitana, <hi rend="ital">a dark grotto in the neighborhood of Naples, through which was a shorter passage to Puteoli</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Grotta di Napoli</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 57:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 57, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cryptarius: <entryFree id="n11751" type="gloss" key="crypta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cryptārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>crypta</etym>, <sense id="n11751.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a superintendent of vaults</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2566</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
crypticus: <entryFree id="n11752" type="greek" key="crypti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cryptĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kruptiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n11752.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">covered, concealed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cryptoporticus: <entryFree id="n11753" type="greek" key="crypto^porti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cryptŏportĭcus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vox hibrida, from <foreign lang="greek">krupto/s</foreign> and porticus</etym>, <sense id="n11753.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a covered gallery</hi> or <hi rend="ital">passage, a vault, a hall</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:16 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 16 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 6, 27</bibl> sq. al.</sense></entryFree>
crysallion: <entryFree id="n11754" type="main" key="cry_salli^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crȳsallĭon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. crystallion.</entryFree>
crystallinus: <entryFree id="n11755" type="greek" key="crystalli^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crystallĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">krusta/llinos</foreign>, <sense id="n11755.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made of crystal, crystalline, crystal</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11755.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calices,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Ver. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 10, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">centra in sapphiris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 9, 39, § 120</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11755.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">crystallĭ-num</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. vas), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:40:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 40, 2</bibl>.— Mostly <hi rend="ital">plur</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:155" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 155</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:53:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 53, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:59:13" default="NO">9, 59, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 11, § 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">PRAEPOSITVS A CRYSTALLINIS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2953</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
crystallion: <entryFree id="n11756" type="greek" key="crystalli^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crystallĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">krusta/llion</foreign>, <sense id="n11756.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, also called</hi> psyllion, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 11, 90, § 140</bibl> (Jan. crysallion).</sense></entryFree>
crystalloides: <entryFree id="n11757" type="greek" key="crystallo^i_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crystallŏīdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">krustalloeidh/s</foreign>, <sense id="n11757.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">crystal-like</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> p. 4, 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
crystallum: <entryFree id="n11758" type="greek" key="crystallum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">crystallum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (analog. to the Gr. <itype>crystallus, i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">kru/stallos</foreign>. <sense id="n11758.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Ice</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 63, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11758.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A crystal, mountain-</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rock-crystal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 9, § 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:25:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 25, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 26, 66, § 192</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:3:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:126" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 126</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11758.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n11758.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Any thing made of crystal, a crystal vase for drinking</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:22:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 22, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:66:5" default="NO">10, 66, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11758.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">That which is similar to crystal</hi>. —So of <hi rend="ital">the glittering precious stone of a ring</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 3, 52.</sense></entryFree>
ctesias: <entryFree id="n11759" type="main" key="Cte_si^a_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ctēsĭās</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kthsi/as</foreign>, <sense id="n11759.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a famous physician of Cnidus in Caria, author of a history of the East</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 106, 110, § 238</bibl>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 18, 2.</sense></entryFree>
ctesibius: <entryFree id="n11760" type="main" key="Cte_si^bi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ctēsĭbĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n11760.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mechanic of Alexandria, distinguished for his inventions in hydraulics</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 6</bibl> (al. 9), p. 280 Bip.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n11760.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ctēsĭbĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Ctesibius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">machina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ctesiphon: <entryFree id="n11761" type="main" key="Cte_si^pho_n1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ctēsĭphōn</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kthsifw=n</foreign>, <sense id="n11761.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Athenian defended by Demosthenes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:56:213 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 56, 213 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n11762" type="main" key="Cte_si^pho_n2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ctēsĭphōn</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ktesifw=n</foreign>, <sense id="n11762.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Assyria, residence of the Parthian kings</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 26, 30, § 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 42</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 8, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Sev. 16, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cuba: <entryFree id="n11763" type="main" key="Cu^ba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŭba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cubo</etym>, <sense id="n11763.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the goddess who protects the lying down of children</hi>, Varr. ap. Don. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 1, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cuballa: <entryFree id="n11764" type="main" key="Cuballa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cuballa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n11764.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in</hi> Gallograecia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 18, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cubatio: <entryFree id="n11765" type="hapax" key="cu^ba_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭbātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cubo</etym>, <sense id="n11765.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lying down</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=54" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 54</bibl> Müll. <cb n="CUBI" /></sense></entryFree>
cubator: <entryFree id="n11766" type="hapax" key="cu^ba_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭbātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cubo</etym>, <sense id="n11766.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who lies down</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 21, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cubicularius: <entryFree id="n11767" type="main" key="cu^bi^cu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭbĭcŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭbĭcŭlāris</orth>, e; <sense id="n11767.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:65:134" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 65, 134</bibl>; <case>dat.</case>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 59</bibl>; but ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 7</bibl>, the better read. is cubiculi Lares; v. cubiculum, I.), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cubiculum</etym>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a sleepingchamber</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11767.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucerna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:39" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 39</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gausapina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:147" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 147</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stragula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 58, 83, § 226</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11767.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭ-bĭcŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a chamber-servant, valet-de-chambre</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc vestri janitores, hunc cubicularii diligunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:4:section=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 4, § 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manere ... cum uno medico et cubicularis duobus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 4</bibl></cit> Roth (al. -ariis); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Pert. 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">decurio cubiculariorum,</quote> <trans><tr>the head of the servants of the bedchamber</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cubiculatus: <entryFree id="n11768" type="hapax" key="cu^bi^cu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭbĭcŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11768.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">furnished with bedchambers</hi> or <hi rend="ital">state-rooms</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:20:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 20, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cubiculum: <entryFree id="n11769" type="main" key="cu^bi^cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭbĭcŭlum</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭbīclum</orth>, per sync., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:30:17" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 30, 17</bibl> dub.), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cubo</etym>, <sense id="n11769.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an apartment for reclining</hi> or (more freq.) <hi rend="ital">for sleeping</hi> (cf. cubo), <hi rend="ital">a resting-</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sleepingchamber, a bedchamber</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11769.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 7</bibl>; Serv. Galba ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:65:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 65, 263</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:23:section=56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 23, § 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lares cubiculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 7</bibl> Roth ex conj. Lips.; v. cubicularius <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n11769.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n11769.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The elevated seat of the emperor in the theatre</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:51:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 51, 4</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n11769.4" n="B" level="2"> In arch., <hi rend="ital">a joint, groove of a stone, its bed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 8</bibl>; cf. cubile, I. B.</sense></entryFree>
cubicus: <entryFree id="n11770" type="greek" key="cu^bi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭbĭcus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cyb-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kubiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n11770.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cubic, cubical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5</bibl></cit>, praef. 3: <cit><quote lang="la">soliditas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 102</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cubile: <entryFree id="n11771" type="main" key="cu^bi_le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭbīle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cubo</etym>, <sense id="n11771.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place of rest, a couch, bed</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11771.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n11771.2" n="1" level="3"> Of men, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:814" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 814</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:985" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 985</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:32:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 32, 90</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 17, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 5, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:2:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 2, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutatorium,</quote> <trans><tr>an audience - chamber</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 11, 10, § 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11771.3" n="b" level="4"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a marriage-bed</hi>, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 183</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:324" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 324</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:592" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 592</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 635</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n11771.4" n="2" level="3"> Of animals, <hi rend="ital">the nest, lair, hole, kennel</hi>, etc.; <cit><quote lang="la">of the mouse: mus pusillus ... aetatem uni cubili numquam committit suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 4, 16</bibl></cit>.—Of dogs, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9:12 sq" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9, 12 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:19:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 19, 9</bibl>.—Of wild beasts, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:49:126" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 49, 126</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of the elk,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 27</bibl></cit>.—Of the mole, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 183</bibl>.—Of bees, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 243</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of serpents, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:3:8 al" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 3, 8 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n11771.5" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the couch of the setting sun</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ortus Solis ab Hesperio cubili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:15:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 15, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cubile noctis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1140" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1140</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11771.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in arch., <hi rend="ital">the joint</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bed of a stone, beam</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 14, 21, § 96</bibl>; cf. cubiculum, II. B.—</sense><sense id="n11771.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: avaritiae non jam vestigia, sed ipsa cubilia videre, <hi rend="ital">the very den</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lair</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:77:section=190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 77, § 190</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:30:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 30, 82</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas (stragis) nos non vestigiis odorantes ingressus tuos, sed totis volutationibus corporis et cubilibus persecuti sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:34:83 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 34, 83 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
cubital: <entryFree id="n11772" type="main" key="cu^bi^tal"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭbĭtal</orth>, <itype>ālis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11772.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cushion for leaning on, an elbow-cushion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 255</bibl> (quoted in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 1, 1</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
cubitalis: <entryFree id="n11773" type="main" key="cu^bi^ta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭbĭtālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cubitum</etym>, <sense id="n11773.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to the elbow;</hi> hence, as a measure, <hi rend="ital">a cubit long</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:34:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 34, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 12, 26, § 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 18, 6 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacrum cubitali majus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cubitio: <entryFree id="n11774" type="hapax" key="cu^bi^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭbĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. cubitus</etym>, <sense id="n11774.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lying down</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 151" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 151</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cubitissim: <entryFree id="n11775" type="spur" key="cu^bi^tissim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭbĭtissim</orth>, a corrupt word in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 2, 42</bibl>; acc. to some, <sense id="n11775.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., lying down.</hi></sense></entryFree>
cubito: <entryFree id="n11776" type="main" key="cu^bi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭbĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <sense id="n11776.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [cubo], <hi rend="ital">to lie down often, to be accustomed to lie down</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">anus hic solet cubitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 15, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">humi (pavones),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super pedes cubitantis reclinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 5</bibl></cit>.—Of sexual intercourse: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquā (aliquo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cubitor: <entryFree id="n11777" type="hapax" key="cu^bi^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭbĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11777.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who lies down</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bos,</quote> <trans><tr>that often lies down in ploughing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cubitorius: <entryFree id="n11778" type="main" key="cu^bi^to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭbĭtōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11778.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a reclining posture</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestimenta,</quote> <trans><tr>clothing worn at table</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 30, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cubitum: <entryFree id="n11779" type="main" key="cu^bi^tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭbĭtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭbĭtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 201, 16</bibl>) [id.], <sense id="n11779.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the elbow</hi> (serving for leaning upon). </sense><sense id="n11779.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <cb n="CUCU" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1</bibl>. 1.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 45, 102, § 249</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:690" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 690</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:343" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 343</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:27:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 27, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 4, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:93 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 93 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n11779.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n11779.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The bending, curvature of a shore</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 13, 18, § 111</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n11779.4" n="B" level="2"> As a measure of length, <hi rend="ital">the distance from the elbow to the end of the middle finger, an ell, a cubit</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 201, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:26:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 26, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 12, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:43 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 43 al.</bibl>—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">assiduo cursu cubitum nullum procedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 12, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cursitare ac ne cubiti quidem mensuram progredi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 38</bibl></cit>.—Hence, Ital. <hi rend="ital">cubito;</hi> Fr. <hi rend="ital">coude</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
cubitura: <entryFree id="n11780" type="main" key="cu^bi^tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭbĭtūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cubo</etym>, <sense id="n11780.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lying down</hi>, Plaut. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 198, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cubitus: <entryFree id="n11781" type="main" key="cu^bi^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭbĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11781.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lying down</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n11781.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">supini, proni, in latera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 14, § 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11781.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp., of coitus (for concubitus), in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 70</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11781.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (abstr. pro concr.), <hi rend="ital">a bed, couch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">foliis cubitus sibi sternunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 9, 38, § 59</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n11782" type="main" key="cu^bi^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭbĭtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. cubitum.</entryFree>
cubo: <entryFree id="n11783" type="main" key="cu^bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭbo</orth>, <itype>ŭi</itype>, ìtúm, 1 (<sense id="n11783.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf. subj.</hi> cubaris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl> (3), 15, 17; <hi rend="ital">perf. inf.</hi> cubasse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 20</bibl>; cf. also Neue, Formenl. II. p. 478), <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>cf. <foreign lang="greek">ku/ptw</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">to lie down</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11783.1" n="I" level="1"> Of persons. </sense><sense id="n11783.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to be in a recumbent posture, to recline</hi>: in lecticā cubans. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:23:section=51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 23, § 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut etiam legationes audiret cubans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">43</bibl>: cubans auspicatur qui in lecto quaerit augurium, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=66:5" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 66, 5</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">pisces cubantes = jacentes,</quote> <trans><tr>flat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 9</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq. and class., </sense><sense id="n11783.3" n="B" level="2"> With particular access. meanings. </sense><sense id="n11783.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To lie asleep, to sleep</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(vilicus) primus cubitu surgat: postremus cubitum eat ... uti suo quisque loco cubet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 5, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cubitum ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:23:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 23, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:59:122" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 59, 122</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubitum abire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubitum discedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:10:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubitum se eo conferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum iste cubaret, in cubiculum introductus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:23:section=56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 23, § 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humi ac sub divo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:72" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 73</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:612" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 612</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n11783.5" n="b" level="4"> Of sexual intercourse, <hi rend="ital">to lie</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquā (aliquo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 112</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 134</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:65 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 65 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:69:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 69, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:78:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes">78, 4 al.</bibl>—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. prol. 132</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 131</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n11783.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To recline at table</hi> (cf. accumbo): <cit><quote lang="la">quo eorum loco quisque cubuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:86:353" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 86, 353</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juxta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille cubans gaudet, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 110</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11783.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To lie sick, to be sick</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">est ei quidam servus qui in morbo cubat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerperio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex duritie alvi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeger,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 72</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec cubat, ille valet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20, 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trans Tiberim longe cubat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 289</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 68</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11783.8" n="II" level="1"> Of inanim. objects. </sense><sense id="n11783.9" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">quā cubat unda freti,</quote> <trans><tr>lies, extends itself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:1:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11783.10" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of places, <hi rend="ital">to be in a sloping direction, to slope</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubantia tecta,</quote> <trans><tr>inclining, sloping</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:518" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 518</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ustica cubans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:17:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 17, 12</bibl></cit>.— Hence, Ital. <hi rend="ital">covare;</hi> Fr. <hi rend="ital">couver.</hi></sense></entryFree>
cubus: <entryFree id="n11784" type="greek" key="cu^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭbus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ku/bos</foreign>, <sense id="n11784.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a die, cube</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5</bibl>, praef. 4.—</sense><sense id="n11784.1" n="B" level="2"> As a measure, Rhem. Fann. 61.—</sense><sense id="n11784.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A cubic number</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:20:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 20, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cuccuru: <entryFree id="n11785" type="main" key="cuccuru"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cuccuru</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cŭcurru</orth>), a word of unknown signif.: <sense id="n11785.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">Afranius in Cinerario: id me celabat cuccuru. An nomen est ut veru, genu?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 214</bibl></cit> P. (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0404,001:Com. Rel. v. 22" default="NO"><author>Afran.</author> Com. Rel. v. 22</bibl> Rib.); cf. cucurio.</sense></entryFree>
cuci: <entryFree id="n11786" type="foreign" key="cu_ci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūci</orth>, <gen>n.</gen> <itype>indecl.</itype> <etym>Pers.; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kou=ki</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n11786.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tree similar to the palm;</hi> acc. to Sprengel, Hyphaene coriacea, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 9, 18, § 62</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cucubalus: <entryFree id="n11787" type="main" key="cucuba^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cucubălus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n11787.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the plant called also</hi> strychnos and strumus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 8, 44, § 68</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> p. 250</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cucubo: <entryFree id="n11788" type="main" key="cu_cu^bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūcŭbo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>cf. <foreign lang="greek">kwku/w</foreign></etym>, of the screech-owl, <sense id="n11788.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hoot</hi>, Auct. Carm. Philom. 14 dub.</sense></entryFree>
cuculla: <entryFree id="n11789" type="main" key="cu^culla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭculla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. cucullus.</entryFree>
cucullatus: <entryFree id="n11790" type="main" key="cu^culla_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭcullātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cucullus</etym>, <sense id="n11790.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hooded, having a hood</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 24, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cucullio: <entryFree id="n11791" type="main" key="cu^culli^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭcullĭo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭculĭo</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 2, 3</bibl>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11791.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a covering for the head, a cap</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, 1</bibl>. 1.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elag. 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Ver. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cucullus: <entryFree id="n11792" type="main" key="cu^cullus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭcullus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭculla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, in eccl. Lat., <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> 21, 389</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Vit. Hil. 46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ennod.</author> Ep. 9, 14</bibl>) [root kal-, of cella, clam, <pb n="487" /> <cb n="CUIC" /> <foreign lang="greek">kalu/ptw</foreign>; cf. culleus], <sense id="n11792.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a covering</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11792.1" n="I" level="1"> Of the head, <hi rend="ital">a cap, hood, fastened to a garment</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:8:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 8, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:98:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 98, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:170" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 170</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">as a disguise,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:145 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 145 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n11792.2" n="II" level="1"> Of the feet, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Pert. 8</bibl> dub.—</sense><sense id="n11792.3" n="III" level="1"> Of merchandise, <hi rend="ital">a conical wrapper</hi> or <hi rend="ital">case</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:2:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 2, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cuculo: <entryFree id="n11793" type="hapax" key="cu^cu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭcŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>cuculus</etym>, onomatop. of the cuckoo, <sense id="n11793.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cry cuckoo</hi>, Auct. Carm. Philom. 35.</sense></entryFree>
cuculus: <entryFree id="n11794" type="main" key="cu^cu_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭcūlus</orth> (cŭcŭlus, Auct. Carm. Philom. 35), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. ku-, to cry; cf. <foreign lang="greek">kwku/w</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n11794.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cuckoo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 26, 66, § 249</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">as a term of reproach,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 73</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 94</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. of foolish men,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 18</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and of dilatory husbandmen, who are not through with their pruning until the cuckoo is heard (after the vernal equinox),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 1</bibl></cit>. 1.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:7:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 7, 31</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 26, 66, § 249</bibl>; Voss ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:403" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 403</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cucuma: <entryFree id="n11795" type="main" key="cu^cu^ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭcŭma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>coquo</etym>. <sense id="n11795.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A cookingvessel, a kettle</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 135, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:8:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 8, 1</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n11795.1" n="II" level="1"> Perh., <hi rend="ital">a small private bath</hi> (opp. thermae), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:79:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 79, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cucumella: <entryFree id="n11796" type="hapax" key="cu^cu^mella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭcŭmella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>cucuma</etym>, <sense id="n11796.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little kettle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:5:17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 5, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cucumeraceus: <entryFree id="n11797" type="main" key="cu^cu^me^ra_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭcŭmĕrācĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n11797.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., cucumber-like, of cucumber</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> p. 2, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cucumerarium: <entryFree id="n11798" type="main" key="cu^cu^me^ra_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭcŭmĕrārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cucumis</etym>, <sense id="n11798.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cucumber-field</hi> (eccl. Lat., transl. of the Heb. <foreign />, Isa. 1, 8), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 1, 1, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cucumis: <entryFree id="n11799" type="main" key="cu^cu^mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭcŭmis</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype> (is, sometimes in the Nat. Hist. of Pliny; e. g. <case>acc.</case> cucumim, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 2, 1, § 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 1, 2, § 3</bibl>; <case>abl.</case> cucumi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:103 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 9, 40, § 103 al.</bibl>; <sense id="n11799.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">together with cucumeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 5, 23, § 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:186" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 12, 61, § 186</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cucumeres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 5, 24, § 69</bibl></cit> (cucumis, Sillig): <cit><quote lang="la">cucumerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:68 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 5, 23, § 68 al.</bibl></cit>), <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n11799.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A cucumber</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:48" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:64 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 23, § 64 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 9, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:25" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:122 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 122 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n11799.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sea-plant, similar in color and odor to the cucumber</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 2, 1, § 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cucurbita: <entryFree id="n11800" type="main" key="cu^curbi^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭcurbĭta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n11800.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gourd</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11800.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:48 sq" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 48 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:69 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 24, § 69 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 9, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11800.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in medic. lang., <hi rend="ital">a cup, cupping-glass</hi> (of similar form), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 46" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:67" default="NO">67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:58" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cucurbitae medicinales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:123 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 10, 42, § 123 al.</bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n11800.3" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a blockhead</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cucurbitarius: <entryFree id="n11801" type="main" key="cu^curbi^ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭcurbĭtārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cucurbita</etym>, <sense id="n11801.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gourd planter</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 112</bibl>, n. 22.</sense></entryFree>
cucurbitatio: <entryFree id="n11802" type="hapax" key="cu^curbi^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭcurbĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cucurbita, II.</etym>, <sense id="n11802.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cupping</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1:32" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 1, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cucurbitinus: <entryFree id="n11803" type="main" key="cu^curbi^ti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭcurbĭtīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cucurbita</etym>, <sense id="n11803.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">like</hi> or <hi rend="ital">similar to a gourd</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pira,</quote> <trans><tr>the gourdpear</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 7, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 15, 16, § 56</bibl>: ficus, Cloatius ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 16, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 15, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cucurbitula: <entryFree id="n11804" type="main" key="cu^curbi^tu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭcurbĭtŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n11804.0" n="I" level="1"> Silvestris, <hi rend="ital">the bitter gourd</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 106" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 106</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n11804.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A cupping-glass</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cucurbitularis: <entryFree id="n11805" type="main" key="cu^curbi^tu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭcurbĭtŭlāris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cucurbitula</etym>, <sense id="n11805.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the field cypress</hi>, = chamaepitys, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 9, 86</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cucurio: <entryFree id="n11806" type="hapax" key="cu_cu_ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūcūrĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>root kar-, to sound; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kre/kw, kraugh/</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n11806.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to crow</hi>, Auct. Carm. Philom. 25.</sense></entryFree>
cucurru: <entryFree id="n11807" type="main" key="cu^curru"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭcurru</orth>, v. cuccuru.</entryFree>
cucus: <entryFree id="n11808" type="main" key="cucus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cucus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n11808.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a daw</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interea Cucus, si in ludum iret, potuisset fieri ut probe litteras sciret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cucutium: <entryFree id="n11809" type="main" key="cucuti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cucutĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cf. cucullus</etym>, <sense id="n11809.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of hood</hi>, Treb. Poll. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 17, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cudo: <entryFree id="n11810" type="main" key="cu_do1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūdo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n11810.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to strike, beat, pound, knock</hi> (rare and only ante-class., and in postAug. prose). </sense><sense id="n11810.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum pilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 4, 21, § 69</bibl></cit> (v. Sillig <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">semina,</quote> <trans><tr>to beat out, thresh</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1044" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1044</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:187" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 187</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">istaec in me cudetur faba,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>I must smart for that</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 90</bibl></cit> Don.—</sense><sense id="n11810.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (of metals), <hi rend="ital">to prepare by beating</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hammering, to forge;</hi> of money, <hi rend="ital">to stamp, coin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plumbeos nummos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anulum,</quote> <trans><tr>to make</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:61" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 61</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n11810.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas tu mihi tenebras cudis?</quote> <trans><tr>forge, prepare</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n11811" type="main" key="cu_do2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūdo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n11811.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a helmet made of raw skin; abl.</hi> cudone, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:495" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 495</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:59" default="NO">16, 59</bibl>; cf.: cudon, <foreign lang="greek">perikefalai/as ei)=dos</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
cuferion: <entryFree id="n11812" type="hapax" key="cuferion"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cuferion</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n11812.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the nose-bleed</hi>, a disease of horses, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Art. Vet. 3, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cuicuimodi: <entryFree id="n11813" type="main" key="cuicuimo^di"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cuicuimŏdi</orth> (ante-class. <orth extent="full" lang="la">quoiquoi mŏdi</orth>) [quisquis-modus], euphon. form for cujuscujusmodi (very rare in MSS., but vouched for by the ancient grammarians; <cb n="CULA" /> v. Kuhner, Gram. I. p. 398; 405 sq.), <sense id="n11813.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of what sort, kind</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">nature soever</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sisne necne ut esse oportet, malus, bonus quoiquoi modi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velim omnia quam diligentissime, cuicuimodi sunt, scribas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 22, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:41:section=107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 41, § 107</bibl> Zumpt and Halm ad loc.; cf. Madv. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:9:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 9, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuicuimodi fuerit illa (lex),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:5:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:34:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 34, 83</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 41, 121</bibl> (al. cujusmodi): <cit><quote lang="la">sed Epicurus, cuicuimodi homo est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:8:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuicuimodi est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cuimodi: <entryFree id="n11814" type="main" key="cuimo^di"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cuimŏdi</orth> <etym>quis-modus</etym> for cujusmodi = qualis, <sense id="n11814.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of what kind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">nature soever</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuimodi esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:13:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 13, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:2:2" default="NO">12, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:15:1" default="NO">12, 15, 1</bibl>; 13, 29, 1 al.</sense></entryFree>
cujas: <entryFree id="n11815" type="main" key="cu_jas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūjas</orth> (archaic <orth extent="full" lang="la">quōjas</orth>), <itype>ātis, or</itype> (anteand post-class.) uncontr. <orth extent="full" lang="la">cūjātis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <sense id="n11815.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pron. interrog</hi>.
