[pronom. stem quo-; cf.: quis, qui], <hi rend="ital">whence originating? of what country, family</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">town? whence? from what place?</hi> = <foreign lang="greek">podapo/s</foreign>; <case>nom.</case> cujatis (quoj-), Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:22:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 22, 51</bibl>; Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 426, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 2, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. prol. 109</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 104, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8</bibl>, p. 212, 31: <cit><quote lang="la">quem cum percunctaretur Scipio, quis et cujas et cur id aetatis in castris fuisset? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:19:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 19, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Socrates cum rogaretur, cujatem se esse diceret, Mundanum inquit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:37:108" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 37, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujates estis? aut quo ex oppido?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cujus: <entryFree id="n11816" type="main" key="cu_jus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūjus</orth> (archaic <orth extent="full" lang="la">quōjus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n11816.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pron. interrog.</hi> [pronom. stem quo-], <hi rend="ital">pertaining to whom? of whom? whose?</hi> (most freq. in Plaut. and Ter.): <cit><quote lang="la">quoja vox sonat procul?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa mulier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 4, 3, 20</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 87</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidicina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujum pecus? an Meliboei?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 87</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quojam esse te vis maxime, ad eum duco te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 4, 5</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 3, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">is Helenam abduxit, quojā caussā nunc facio opsidium Ilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suamne esse dicebat? ... non ... quojam igitur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 4, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: cujā operā, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 81, 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11816.1" n="(b)" level="5"> With a suffixed <hi rend="ital">nam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quojanam vox prope me sonat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 55</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n11817" type="main" key="cu_jus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūjus</orth> (archaic <orth extent="full" lang="la">quōjus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n11817.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pron. rel.</hi> [from cujus, <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> of qui], <hi rend="ital">pertaining to whom, of whom, whose</hi> (rare): cujum id censebis esse reddes, ancient form of an oath in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:4:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 4, 2</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum ego pro istisce ambabus, quojae erant, domino dedi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 40</bibl></cit>: is denique, cuja ea uxor fuerat, Plin. Secundus, Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:16:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 16, 5</bibl>: ea caedes si potissimum crimini datur, detur ei cuja interfuit, non ei cuja nihil interfuit, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 950</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut optimā condicione sit is, cuja res, cujum periculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:54:section=142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 54, § 142</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cujuscemodi: <entryFree id="n11818" type="main" key="cu_jusce^mo^di"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūjuscĕmŏdi</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">quōj-</orth>) or <orth extent="full" lang="la">cūjuscĕ mŏdi</orth> <etym>quisce-modus</etym>, <sense id="n11818.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of what kind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">nature soever</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">voces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 209, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cujuscumquemodi: <entryFree id="n11819" type="spur" key="cu_juscumque^mo^di"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūjuscumquĕmŏdi</orth>, a false read. for cujusque modi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 39:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 39, 6</bibl>.</entryFree>
cujusdammodi: <entryFree id="n11820" type="main" key="cu_jusdammo^di"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūjusdammŏdi</orth>, better <orth extent="full" lang="la">cūjusdam mŏdi</orth>, <sense id="n11820.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of some sort</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:12:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 12, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:14:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 14, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cujusmodi: <entryFree id="n11821" type="main" key="cu_jusmo^di"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūjusmŏdi</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">quōj-</orth>), also <orth extent="full" lang="la">cūjus mŏdi</orth> <etym>quis-modus</etym> = qualis, <sense id="n11821.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of what kind</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupio cognoscere iter tuum cujusmodi sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 20, 3</bibl></cit>; Auct. B. Afr. 31; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 132</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11821.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of whatever kind</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 7, 4</bibl> (al. leg. cuicuimodi); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:41:121" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 41, 121</bibl> (al. cuicuimodi); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 2, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cujusmodicumque: <entryFree id="n11822" type="main" key="cu_jusmo^dicumque_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūjusmŏdicumquē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>quicumque-modus</etym>, <sense id="n11822.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of whatever kind</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujusmodicumque mater sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 6, 17</bibl></cit> Ramsey (where B. and K. read cujuscumque modi).</sense></entryFree>
cujusnam: <entryFree id="n11823" type="main" key="cu_jusnam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūjusnam</orth>, <itype>cūjanam, cūjumnam</itype>, v. 1. cujus, <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>.</entryFree>
cujusquemodi: <entryFree id="n11824" type="main" key="cu_jusque^mo^di"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūjusquĕmŏdi</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">quōj-</orth>) or <orth extent="full" lang="la">cūjus-quĕ mŏdi</orth> <etym>quisque modus</etym>, <sense id="n11824.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of whatever kind</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 7, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 135</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cujusvis: <entryFree id="n11825" type="hapax" key="cu_jusvis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūjusvis</orth>, <itype>cujavis, cujumvis</itype> <etym>from cujus-vis, <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> of quivis</etym>, <sense id="n11825.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to whomever pertaining, whosesoever, of any one</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujavis oratio insimulari potest, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 326, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cularo: <entryFree id="n11826" type="main" key="Cula^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Culăro</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n11826.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in</hi> Gallia Narbonensis, afterwards Gratianopolis, now <hi rend="ital">Grenoble</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:23:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 23, 7</bibl>. <cb n="CULM" /></sense></entryFree>
culcita: <entryFree id="n11827" type="main" key="culci^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">culcĭta</orth> (in MSS. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">culcĭtra</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>etym. dub.; acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=167" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 167</bibl> Müll.; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=50:8" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 50, 8</bibl>, from calco</etym>, <sense id="n11827.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sack filled with feathers, wool, hair</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">for lying upon, warming</hi>, etc.; <hi rend="ital">a bed, cushion, mattress, pillow</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 86, 5 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:19:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 19, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 87:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 87, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:108:23" default="NO">108, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:54 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 54 al.</bibl> —Of <hi rend="ital">a little cushion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">patch for the eye</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 42</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">a resting-place</hi> in a conservatory of birds, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 14</bibl>.— In the lang. of comedy: gladium faciam culcitam Eumque incumbam, <hi rend="ital">I will make the sword my couch</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">I will make away with myself</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 4, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
culcitarius: <entryFree id="n11828" type="gloss" key="culci^ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">culcĭtārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>culcita</etym>, <sense id="n11828.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cushion-maker</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 313</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
culcitella: <entryFree id="n11829" type="main" key="culci^tella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">culcĭtella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11829.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little cushion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mattress</hi>, transf. in mal. part., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 2, 14</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sponda interior regiae lecticae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 49</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
culcitula: <entryFree id="n11830" type="main" key="culci^tu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">culcĭtŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11830.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small cushion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mattress</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 35, 20</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 326, 20</bibl> K.</sense></entryFree>
culearis: <entryFree id="n11831" type="main" key="cu_le^a_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūlĕāris</orth>, v. cullearis.</entryFree>
culeus: <entryFree id="n11832" type="main" key="cu_le^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūlĕus</orth>, v. culleus.</entryFree>
culex: <entryFree id="n11833" type="main" key="cu^lex1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭlex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 22</bibl>), <sense id="n11833.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gnat, midge</hi> (comprising very many species), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:2 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 2, 1, § 2 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:118" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 35, 41, § 118</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:255" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 27, 44, § 255</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:391" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 391</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:60" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:93:9 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 93, 9 al.</bibl>—Also the title of a writing of Verg.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Heyn. Verg. tom. iv. prooem.—As a term of reproach for a wanton lover,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n11834" type="main" key="culex2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">culex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, v. culix.</entryFree>
culicellus: <entryFree id="n11835" type="hapax" key="cu^li^cellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭlĭcellus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>1. culex</etym>, <sense id="n11835.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little gnat</hi>: amasio Tullae, i. e. <hi rend="ital">buzzing round her</hi>, Ser. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 513</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
culiculare: <entryFree id="n11836" type="main" key="cu^li^cu^la_re^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭlĭcŭlārĕ</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11836.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fly-net</hi> (late Lat.; cf. conopeum), Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:80" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 80</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
culiculus: <entryFree id="n11837" type="gloss" key="cu^li^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭlĭcŭlus</orth>, <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11837.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little gnat</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">kwuw/pion</foreign>, Gloss. Cyrill.</sense></entryFree>
culigna: <entryFree id="n11838" type="greek" key="cu^ligna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭligna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kuli/xnh</foreign>, <sense id="n11838.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small drinking-vessel, a cup</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 132, 1</bibl>; Fragm. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=55:2" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 55, 2</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
culina: <entryFree id="n11839" type="main" key="cu^li_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭlīna</orth> (old orthogr. <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏlīna</orth>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 55, 18 sq.</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. çar, çri, to cook, mix</etym>, <sense id="n11839.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kitchen</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11839.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:13:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 13, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 18, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 114:26" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 114, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 73</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 80</bibl>; cf. of <hi rend="ital">a portable kitchen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 78:23" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 78, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:250" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 250</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11839.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n11839.3" n="A" level="2"> Culina vocatur locus, in quo epulae in funere comburuntur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=65:12" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 65, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11839.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">food, fare, victuals</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Murenā praebente domum, Capitone culinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 38</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:162" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 162</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:14" default="NO">14, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
culinarius: <entryFree id="n11840" type="main" key="cu^li_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭlīnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>culina</etym>, <sense id="n11840.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to the kitchen, culinary, kitchen-</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11840.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">operae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, B. Parth. p. 201" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, B. Parth. p. 201</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n11840.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭlīnārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a kitchen servant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 230" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 230</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
culiola: <entryFree id="n11841" type="gloss" key="cu_li^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūlĭŏla</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cull-</orth>) <itype>cortices nucum viridium, dicta a similitudine culeorum, quibus vinum sive oleum continetur</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=50:12" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 50, 12</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
culix: <entryFree id="n11842" type="main" key="culix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">culix</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n11842.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 23, § 68</bibl>.—Also <orth extent="full" lang="la">culex</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 9, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cullearis: <entryFree id="n11843" type="main" key="culle^a_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cullĕāris</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cūl-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>culleus, II. A.</etym>, <sense id="n11843.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of the measure of a</hi> culleus: <cit><quote lang="la">labrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
culleus: <entryFree id="n11844" type="greek" key="culle^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cullĕus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">cūl-</orth>, and in the signif. II. B., <orth extent="full" lang="la">cōl-</orth>), <itype>i</itype> (<sense id="n11844.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. plur.</hi> cullea, <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 197</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> culleūm, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 11, 1</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">koleo/s</foreign>, Ion. <foreign lang="greek">kouleo/s</foreign> (a sheath; hence), <hi rend="ital">a leather bag, a sack for holding liquids.</hi> </sense><sense id="n11844.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">Te ipsam culleo ego cras faciam ut deportere in pergulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 8, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 20, 19, § 82</bibl>.—Parricides were sewed up in bags and drowned, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:25:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 25, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:50:149" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 50, 149</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:9:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 9, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:2:section=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 2, § 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:8:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 8, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:214" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 214</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: culleus ligneus, of <hi rend="ital">a ship without rigging</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 3</bibl> (7), 15, 9.—</sense><sense id="n11844.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n11844.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A large measure for liquids, holding</hi> 20 amphorae, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 148, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11844.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The scrotum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:84" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 84</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 13, 8</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, coleos habere, i. q. virum esse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 44, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
culmen: <entryFree id="n11845" type="main" key="culmen"><orth extent="full" lang="la">culmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, contr. form of columen, q. v.</entryFree>
culmeus: <entryFree id="n11846" type="main" key="culme^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">culmĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>culmus</etym>, <sense id="n11846.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of siraw</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecti culmina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 13, 387</bibl></cit>. <pb n="488" /> <cb n="CULP" /></sense></entryFree>
culminia: <entryFree id="n11847" type="main" key="Culminia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Culminia</orth>, v. Colminiana.</entryFree>
culmosus: <entryFree id="n11848" type="main" key="culmo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">culmōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>culmus</etym>, <sense id="n11848.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stalklike</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratres,</quote> <trans><tr>sprung from the dragonteeth</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 6, 72</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
culmus: <entryFree id="n11849" type="main" key="culmus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">culmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>kindr. with culmen</etym>, <sense id="n11849.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stalk, stem</hi>, esp. of grain, <hi rend="ital">straw</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:48:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 48, 3</bibl> (Cod. Vindob. culmen); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 111</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 317 al.</bibl>—Of other plants: <cit><quote lang="la">milii, panici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 10, § 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">holci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 10, 63, § 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:3:128" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 3, 128</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
culpa: <entryFree id="n11850" type="main" key="culpa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">culpa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>kindr. in root with scelus; cf. Sanscr. skhal-, errare</etym>, <sense id="n11850.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">crime, fault, blame, failure, defect</hi> (as a state worthy of punishment; on the contr. delictum, peccatum, etc., as punishable acts; diff. from scelus, which implies an intentional injury of others; but culpa includes in it an error in judgment). </sense><sense id="n11850.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n11850.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (very freq. in every period and species of composition): <cit><quote lang="la">delictum suum Suamque ut culpam expetere in mortalem sinat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 2, 33</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non C. Rabirium culpa delicti, non invidia vitae ... in discrimen capitis vocaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc uno genere omnis inesse culpas istius maximas avaritiae, majestatis, dementiae, libidinis, crudelitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:17:section=42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 17, § 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et culpam in facto, non scelus esse meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:1:24" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 1, 24</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid hujus factum'st culpa, non factum'st mea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is quidem In culpā non est,</quote> <trans><tr>to blame, in fault</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 78</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidio ad eorum, qui in culpā essent, timorem uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malo Tironis verecundiam in culpā esse, quam inliberalitatem Curii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 6, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 4, 10</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut jam sit in iis culpa, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tua culpa nonnulla est,</quote> <trans><tr>you are somewhat to blame, not without fault</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed haec mea culpa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:35:133" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 35, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne penes ipsos culpa esset cladis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:36:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 36, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">penes Aetolos culpam belli esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 33, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:18:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 18, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 30</bibl> (39), 2: <cit><quote lang="la">culpa, quae te est penes, Ter. hec. 4, 1, 20: culpa abest ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:64" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem extra culpam belli esse judicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:19:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 19, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in mutum confers culpam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conferre in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 96</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:5:14 al" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 5, 14 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">culpam transferre in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 8, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suam quisque culpam auctores ad negotia transferunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contrahere culpam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 24, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culpam non modo derivare in aliquem, sed communicare cum altero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:20:section=49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 20, § 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in culpā ponere aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:45:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 45, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indecorant bene nata (pectora) culpae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 15, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">seraque fata, Quae manent culpas etiam sub Orco,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 11, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2, p. 28, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, p. 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11850.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n11850.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The crime of unchastity, a faux pas</hi> (cf. crimen, II. A. 2.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 37</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 172</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 6, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 24</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n11850.5" n="2" level="3"> Mostly in jurid. Lat., <hi rend="ital">the fault of remissness, neglect</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:2:72" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 2, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:1:68" default="NO">18, 1, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:5:8:section=3" default="NO">42, 5, 8, § 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec sum facturus (rem) vitio culpāve minorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11850.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">any thing mischievous</hi> or <hi rend="ital">injurious, mischief</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">continuo culpam (sc. ovem aegram) ferro compesce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:468" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 468</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedula (i. e. meretrix),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 5, 20.—</sense><sense id="n11850.7" n="B" level="2"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">a fault, defect</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">operum et laudes et culpae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
culpabilis: <entryFree id="n11851" type="main" key="culpa_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">culpābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>culpa</etym>, <sense id="n11851.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">worthy of blame, culpable, criminal</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid (opp. laudabile),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinio de diis (opp. digna),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, p. 222</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanto culpabilius est, non observare quod possis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Uxor. 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">culpābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">culpably</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 9:40" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 9, 40</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 39, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:17:172" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 17, 172</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
culpatio: <entryFree id="n11852" type="hapax" key="culpa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">culpātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>culpo</etym>, <sense id="n11852.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reproach, blame</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:22:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 22, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
culpatus: <entryFree id="n11853" type="main" key="culpa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">culpātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from culpo.</entryFree>
culpito: <entryFree id="n11854" type="hapax" key="culpi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">culpĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>culpo</etym>, <sense id="n11854.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to blame</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reproach severely</hi> or <hi rend="ital">harshly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jusjurandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
culpo: <entryFree id="n11855" type="main" key="culpo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">culpo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>culpa</etym>. <sense id="n11855.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To reproach</hi> or <hi rend="ital">blame a person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing as wrong</hi> or <hi rend="ital">faulty, to censure, reprove, disapprove, condemn</hi> (syn.: reprehendo, vitupero; opp. laudo, probo, etc.; rare; mostly<cb n="CULT" />  post-Aug.; never in the Cic. per.). </sense><sense id="n11855.1" n="a" level="4"> With personal objects: <cit><quote lang="la">quos modo culpavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:581" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 581</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: Neronem, Suet. Vit. Pers. —<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudatur (prodigus) ab his, culpatur ab illis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 4, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 5, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:60" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ob id culparetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:72" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sola est, in quā merito culpetur, pecuniae cupiditas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 16 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num culpandus est qui coepit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 17, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:19:8" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 19, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11855.2" n="b" level="4"> With things as objects: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc (opp. laudare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciem deae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:322" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 322</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus duros (with reprehendere inertes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:446" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 446</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:60:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 60, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modum praemii poenaeve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:38" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">factum ipsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plura culpanda sunt quam laudanda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 5:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 8, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11855.3" n="c" level="4"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">culpetne probetne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 256</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 524</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 82</bibl>.— Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">culpanda</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">things deserving censure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et probandorum et culpandorum ex iis confirmatio eosdem gradus habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11855.4" n="II" level="1"> Culpare aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to declare something as a crime, to impute a fault to, to complain of, find fault with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbore nunc aquas Culpante, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 1, 31</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">agrorum infecunditatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">1: culpantur frustra calami,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">culpā-tus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n11855.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Worthy of reproach, blamable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Paris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:602" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 602</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culpatius esse arbitror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:7:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11855.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Corrupted, spoiled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
culte: <entryFree id="n11856" type="main" key="culte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cultē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. colo, <sense id="n11856.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
cultello: <entryFree id="n11857" type="main" key="cultello"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cultello</orth>, no <sense id="n11857.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cultellus</etym>. </sense><sense id="n11857.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To make in the shape of a knife</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spinam dorsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 25, 38, § 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:13" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 2, 5, § 13</bibl> Sillig <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n11857.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To level land by the coulter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Limit. p. 43" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Limit. p. 43</bibl> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
cultellulus: <entryFree id="n11858" type="hapax" key="cultellu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cultellŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11858.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little knife</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cultellus: <entryFree id="n11859" type="main" key="cultellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cultellus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>culter</etym>, <sense id="n11859.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small knife</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11859.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:69:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 69, 2</bibl>; id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 195, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:115 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 25, 54, § 115 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n11859.2" n="II" level="1"> Lignei, <hi rend="ital">wooden pegs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pins</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
culter: <entryFree id="n11860" type="main" key="culter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">culter</orth>, <itype>tri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>kindr. with Sanscr. kar, to wound, kill; cf. per-cello, clades</etym>. <sense id="n11860.0" n="I" level="1"> Orig. <hi rend="ital">a plough-coulter, ploughshare</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:171 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 18, 48, § 171 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n11860.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a knife;</hi> so <hi rend="ital">a vintner's knife</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:25:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 25, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:45:4" default="NO">12, 45, 4</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">a butcher's knife</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:48:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 48, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ad cultrum bovem emunt,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>for slaughter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 13" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 13</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">a razor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultros metuens tonsorios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:7:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultrum tonsorium super jugulum meum posui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 108, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 59, 59, § 211</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">a hunting-knife</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 13</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">a cook's knife</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 2, 3</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 195, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tympanum versatile, in cultro collocatum,</quote> <trans><tr>placed on the edge, on the small side, perpendicularly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 14</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">in the same sense: in cultrum collocare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 10</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: sub cultro, <hi rend="ital">under the knife</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in extreme peril</hi> or <hi rend="ital">distress</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
culticula: <entryFree id="n11861" type="gloss" key="culti^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cultĭcŭla</orth> <itype>fusticulus quidam ligneus in sacris dicebatur</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=50:9" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 50, 9</bibl> Müll., where Lind. reads culcitula.</entryFree>
cultio: <entryFree id="n11862" type="main" key="culti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cultĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. colo</etym>. <sense id="n11862.0" n="I" level="1"> Agri, <hi rend="ital">a cultivation, preparation of ground, agriculture</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:16:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 16, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:97:section=226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 97, § 226</bibl> (others, less correctly, agricultio in one word; <cit><quote lang="la">v. agricultio): cultionis labor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Fug. Saec. 8, 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11862.1" n="II" level="1"> (In acc. with colo, II. B.) <hi rend="ital">Veneration, reverence</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, p. 146</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5</bibl>, p. 178.</sense></entryFree>
cultor: <entryFree id="n11863" type="main" key="cultor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cultor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n11863.0" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">one who bestows care</hi> or <hi rend="ital">labor upon a thing, an elaborator, cultivator</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">agrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:34:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 34, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:25:4" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 25, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:29:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 29, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">agricultor: virentis agelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:39:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 39, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis,</quote> <trans><tr>a vine-dresser</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:14:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 14, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alveorum,</quote> <trans><tr>a bee-master, apiarist</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:3:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of a bullock: <cit><quote lang="la">pauperis agri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:515" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 515</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11863.1" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Absol., a cultivator</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tiller of land, a husbandman, planter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 46:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 46, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 34, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:11:9" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 11, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:19:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 19, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:425" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 425</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultores (opp. oppidani),</quote> <trans><tr>countrymen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 55</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 87</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11863.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (acc. to colo, I. B.), <hi rend="ital">an inhabitant, a dweller</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 17, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collis ejus (sc. Janiculi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:10:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 10, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">collis Heliconii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cupua Tuscis veteribus cultoribus adempta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:28:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 28, 6</bibl></cit>: nemorum,<cb n="CULT" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 114</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">antiqui (Capuae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:38:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 38, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(insularum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 31, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli (Juppiter),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Euboicus tumidarum aquarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 4</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n11863.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (acc. to colo, II. A. and B.). </sense><sense id="n11863.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A fosterer, supporter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonorum (with fautor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:46:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 46, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidissimus imperii Romani (Hiero),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:32:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 32, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenum,</quote> <trans><tr>a tutor, teacher</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:63" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veritatis, fraudis inimici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:109" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 30, 109</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">aequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juris et aequarum legum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:37:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 37, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 28, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:84:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 84, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11863.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A worshipper, reverencer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 34, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:327" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 327</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diligentissimus religionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:50:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 50, 1</bibl></cit>.—Also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:788" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 788</bibl>.—Hence, in later relig. lang., <hi rend="ital">a priest of some deity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deūm matris,</quote> <trans><tr>a priest of Cybele</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 938</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1578</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cultrarius: <entryFree id="n11864" type="main" key="cultra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cultrārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>culter</etym>, <sense id="n11864.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slayer of the victim</hi> (for sacrifice), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4175</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cultratus: <entryFree id="n11865" type="hapax" key="cultra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cultrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n11865.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">knifeshaped</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 7, § 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cultrix: <entryFree id="n11866" type="main" key="cultrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cultrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cultor</etym>. <sense id="n11866.0" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">she who labors at</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cares for a thing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">earum rerum quas terra gignit ... augendarum et alendarum quandam cultricem esse, quae sit scientia atque ars agricolarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:14:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 14, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11866.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A female inhabitant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemorum Latonia virgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:557" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 557</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">montibus Idri (Diana),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:300" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 300</bibl></cit> Sillig <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">collis (Janiculi) haec aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:245" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 245</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11866.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., of things as subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">foci secura patella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:26" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11866.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a female worshipper</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum montium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Mort. Pers. 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cultura: <entryFree id="n11867" type="main" key="cultu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cultūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. colo</etym>. <sense id="n11867.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A cultivating, care, cultivation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2</bibl></cit>, praef. § 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:42 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 42 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1366" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1366</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:30:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 30, 83</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 35, 94</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 29, 71</bibl>, and agricultura: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:14:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 14, 39</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri culturas docuit usus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1447" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1447</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11867.1" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Absol., agriculture, tillage, husbandry</hi>, in the broadest sense (cf. agricola), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:18" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1:7" default="NO">1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 14</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>, of the several parts of husbandry, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:30" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:3" default="NO">11, 2, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n11867.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n11867.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Care, culture, cultivation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultura animi philosophia est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:5:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit> (v. the figure in connection); so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">culturae patientem commodare aurem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11867.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An honoring</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">potentis amici,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a courting, flattering</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 86</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11867.5" n="2" level="3"> Of religious worship (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Dei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 7 al.</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 21</bibl>.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
cultus: <entryFree id="n11868" type="main" key="cultus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cultus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from 1. colo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n11869" type="main" key="cultus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cultus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. colo</etym>. <sense id="n11869.0" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">a laboring at, labor, care, cultivation, culture</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quod est tam asperum saxetum, in quo agricolarum cultus non elaboret?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:25:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 25, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agricolae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 12, 7</bibl></cit>; Quint. prooem. § 26; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(oves) neque sustentari neque ullum fructum edere ex se sine cultu hominum et curatione possent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:63:158" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 63, 158</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cultus et curatio corporis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 34, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis cultus fructusque Cereris in iis locis interisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:51:section=114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 51, § 114</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11869.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n11869.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (also rare), <hi rend="ital">training, education, culture</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">malo cultu corruptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:26:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 26, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <trans><tr>mental discipline</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:19:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 19, 54</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">recti cultus pectora roborant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 123</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:8:18" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 9, 8, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:6:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 6, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos (barbaros reges) nulla eruditio, nullus litterarum cultus imbuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:17:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tam dignum cultu atque labore ducamus (sc. quam vocem)?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 16, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11869.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n11869.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An honoring, reverence, adoration, veneration</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophia nos primum ad deorum cultum erudivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:26:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 26, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:53:161" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 53, 161</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:425" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 425</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exquisitus religionis cultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:2:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:4:4" default="NO">4, 4, 4</bibl>.— In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">justis ac piis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de adventu regis et cultu sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 58</bibl></cit>.— Far more freq. and class. in prose and poetry, </sense><sense id="n11869.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Care directed to the refinement of life</hi> (opp. to a state of nature), i. e. <hi rend="ital">arrangements for living, style, manner of life, culture, cultivation, elegance, polish, civilization, refinement</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">homines a ferā agrestique vitā ad humanum cultum civilemque deducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:8:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 8, 33</bibl></cit>; cf.: eadem mediocritas ad omnem usum cultumque vitae transferenda est. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:39:140" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 39, 140</bibl>: <pb n="489" /> <cb n="CUM" /> (Belgae) a cultu atque humanitate provinciae longissime absunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:730" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 730</bibl>; and in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultusque artesque virorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:28:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 28, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:39:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 39, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrestis et rusticus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 4, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">feri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multas (artes) ad animorum corporumque cultum ... invexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio victu atque cultu aetatem agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 37:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 37, 6</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with victus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 11:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 11, 4 al.</bibl>; cf. of <hi rend="ital">improvement, cultivation of mind</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi cultus ille erat ei quasi quidam humanitatis cibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:19:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 19, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non mores patrios solum, sed etiam cultum vestitumque mutavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 3, 1</bibl></cit>. —In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">luxury, voluptuousness, wantonness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libido stupri, ganeae ceterique cultūs non minor incesserat,</quote> <trans><tr>sensual indulgences</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 13, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cultus ac desidia imperatoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:21:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 21, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n11869.6" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of <hi rend="ital">ornaments of style</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in verbis effusiorem, ut ipsi vocant, cultum adfectaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:58" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 58</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 5, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:124 al" default="NO">10, 1, 124 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n11869.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Style of dress, external appearance, clothing, dress, garb, apparel, attire;</hi> esp. <hi rend="ital">ornament, decoration, splendid dress, splendor</hi> (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">aequato omnium cultu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastoralis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam maxime miserabilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 33, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Hab. Mul. 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:19:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 19, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incinctus Gabino cultu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justo mundior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 15, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amoenior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:44:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 44, 11</bibl></cit> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:40" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl>, prooem. § 20; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 44</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 8, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 9, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:609" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 609</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
culullus: <entryFree id="n11870" type="main" key="cu^lullus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŭlullus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (acc. to Acro upon <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:31:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 31, 11</bibl>, orig. a sacrificial vessel for liquids; later, in gen.), <sense id="n11870.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drinking-vessel, beaker, goblet, cup, bowl</hi>, Hor. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:434" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 434</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
culus: <entryFree id="n11871" type="main" key="cu_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cūlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>perh. kindr. with <foreign lang="greek">koi=los</foreign>, of a curving form; cf. 1. anus</etym>, <sense id="n11871.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the posteriors, fundament</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:23:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 23, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:97:2" default="NO" valid="yes">97, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:98:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 98, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cum: <entryFree id="n11872" type="main" key="cum1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cum</orth> (archaic form COM, found in an inscr., COM PREIVATVD; in MSS. sometimes <orth extent="full" lang="la">quom</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">quum</orth>), <pos>prep.</pos> with <case>abl.</case> [for skom, Sanscr. root sak, together; cf. sequor, and Gr. <foreign lang="greek">koino/s, su)n</foreign>], designates in gen. accompaniment, community, connection of one object with another (opp. sine, separatim, etc.), <sense id="n11872.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with, together, together with, in connection</hi> or <hi rend="ital">company with, along with;</hi> sometimes also to be translated <hi rend="ital">and</hi>. </sense><sense id="n11872.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 95</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui cum Amphitruone abiit hinc in exercitum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> prol. 125: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Pansā vixi in Pompeiano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 20, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper ille antea cum uxore, tum sine eā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:21:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 21, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibuscum essem libenter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 21, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum quibus in ceteris intellegis afuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si cenas hodie mecum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vagamur egentes cum conjugibus et liberis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">errare malo cum Platone, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:17:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 17, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui unum imperium unumque magistratum cum ipsis habeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 3</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n11872.2" n="b" level="4"> In an expression of displeasure: <cit><quote lang="la">in' hinc, quo dignus, cum donis tuis Tam lepidis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 4, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:6:7 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 6, 7 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n11872.3" n="B" level="2"> In a designation of time with which some action concurs: <cit><quote lang="la">egone abs te abii hinc hodie cum diluculo?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 121</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">cum primo luci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cras cum filio cum primo luci ibo hinc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:31:112" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 31, 112</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum primā luce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">cum primo lumine solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 130</bibl></cit>: cum primo mane, Auct. B. Afr. 62: cum mane, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 372</bibl> P: <cit><quote lang="la">pariter cum ortu solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 106:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 106, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pariter cum occasu solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 68:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 68, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sole reliquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:568" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 568</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">mane cum luci simul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 1, 31</bibl></cit>; v. simul: exiit cum nuntio (i. e. <hi rend="ital">at the same time with</hi>, etc.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
